alert.note: Alert for Northwest Highlands; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 9:28PM MST until December 29 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 to 3 inches below 7500 feet and 3 to 6 inches above 7500 feet, except up to 9 inches on west facing slopes, mountain peaks, and on Highway 550 from Cuba over the continental divide. Southwest and west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts near 40 mph, except up to 50 mph on Mount Taylor. * WHERE...Northwest Highlands, West Central Mountains, and West Central Plateau. * WHEN...Until Midnight MST Wednesday Night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40 and U.S. Highway 550 along the continental divide. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds are expected late tonight through Wednesday with weakening speeds thereafter.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Highlands; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau
